definition: chain/cable (unit of length: 100 fathoms, about 185 m)/chain (unit of length: 66 feet, about 20 m)/to chain/to enchain
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

sentences.english: The chain reaction that actually runs the reactor can be shut off in a matter of seconds.
sentences.chinese: 實際運行反應堆的鏈式反應可以在數秒左右被關閉。

sentences.english: The control rods absorb the neutrons and kill the chain reaction instantaneously.
sentences.chinese: 控制棒可以吸收中子，從而瞬間停止鏈式反應。

sentences.english: Spontaneous photons initiate stimulated emission and the chain reaction begins.
sentences.chinese: 自發發射的光子引起受激發射，開始了鏈式反應。

sentences.english: Alright, next time we'll do chain reactions.
sentences.chinese: 好，下一次我們討論鏈式反應。
